text:
It seems that margin-* properties are ignored on non-body regions (see
attachment for an example). I must admit that I do not comprehend the XSL-FO
specification to the point whether this is compliant or not :-).

Oleg Tkachenko <olegt@multiconn.com> submitted a patch yesterday to fop-dev that
"tries to unify regions rendering in all renderers". I haven't checked whether
this patch solves these bugs, too.
creator: tim@tim-landscheidt.de
tim@tim-landscheidt.de
text:
Created attachment 2351
Test case for margins on non-body regions.

I believe non-body regions don't have margin properties, at least the spec
(http://www.w3.org/TR/xsl/slice6.html#fo_region-before) doesn't mention them.
You can use fo:simple-page-master + fo:region-body margins instead.
creator: oleg@tkachenko.com
tim@tim-landscheidt.de
text:
I stand corrected :-(. Though I have absolutely no idea why not to have margin-*
properties on non-body regions. Bug closed.
